decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use the Balustrade Spy along with other cards like Generous Ent and Sagu Wildling to mill through your deck and put your important combo pieces into your graveyard. Cards like Masked Vandal and Mesmeric Fiend help disrupt your opponent's game plan while cards like Lotleth Giant and Dread Return provide a win condition through direct damage or overwhelming board presence. The deck also includes ramp and card draw elements to help quickly assemble the combo and maintain consistency.

The primary strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures that can quickly build up a strong board presence. Cards like Novice Inspector and Lunarch Veteran help to generate value and provide early game pressure, while cards like Battle Screech can create a wide board of tokens for a strong attack. The inclusion of cards like Prismatic Strands and Guardians' Pledge can help protect the creatures and boost their power. Overall, the deck aims to swarm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and maintain control of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive swarm of Elves. By utilizing mana ramp cards like Fyndhorn Elves and Llanowar Elves, the player can quickly generate a large amount of mana to bring out powerful creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Timberwatch Elf. The deck also includes cards like Priest of Titania and Generous Ent to further boost mana production and increase the power of the Elves. Overall, the strategy is to flood the board with creatures and overpower the opponent before they have a chance to build up their own resources.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It also includes cards to generate card advantage and protect the board with instant speed spells. The inclusion of token generators and anthem effects helps to buff the creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to curve out efficiently and apply constant pressure to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards that provide flexibility in dealing with threats ensures the deck has answers to various situations.

This deck focuses on playing powerful artifact creatures and utilizing cards that benefit from artifacts being on the battlefield. By generating a fast and aggressive board presence, the deck can overwhelm opponents quickly. The inclusion of removal spells and lifegain options helps to maintain control of the game while pressuring the opponent. Using a combination of efficient creatures, card draw, and burn spells, this deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can set up their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage. The Gates archetype provides mana fixing and additional card draw, while the inclusion of creatures like Sacred Cat and Squadron Hawk help to establish an early board presence. The deck also relies on the synergy between cards like Prismatic Strands and LÃ³rien Revealed to protect key permanents and stall the game until the player can establish a dominant position.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, utilizing mana acceleration like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to cast powerful threats early on. Cards like Avenging Hunter and Goliath Paladin serve as finishers, while Writhing Chrysalis and Eldrazi Repurposer provide additional threats. Thraben Charm and Malevolent Rumble help control the board and remove opposing creatures, allowing for a smooth path to victory. The mana base is designed to support the heavy green presence in the deck, with a splash of red and white for additional versatility.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells, aiming to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By using efficient creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary, alongside powerful burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to put intense pressure on the opponent from the very beginning. With cards like Rally at the Hornburg to buff the team and finishers like Fireblast to deliver the final blow, this deck excels at rapid and decisive victories.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using creatures like Balustrade Spy and Axebane Guardian to mill your library and get a ton of lands into play. Once the combo is set up, you can use Dread Return to bring back a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant to finish off your opponent in one fell swoop. The deck also includes utility creatures like Mesmeric Fiend and Masked Vandal to disrupt your opponent's plans and keep them off balance. With the right setup, this combo deck can be incredibly lethal.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and creature manipulation, while also generating value from sacrificing permanents and recurring creatures. With a mix of graveyard interaction, card draw, and board wipes, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory. The Golgari / Jund color combination allows for a versatile range of answers and threats, with a focus on generating incremental advantage over time to overwhelm the opponent. Overall, the deck prioritizes resource management and strategic decision-making to outpace and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with low-cost aggressive creatures and pump spells. By utilizing cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl, you can ramp up your mana to play powerful threats like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter early in the game. Additionally, Writhing Chrysalis can provide additional creatures to the board, while Malevolent Rumble and Ram Through can help clear the way for your attackers. Overall, this Gruul Aggro deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain it with efficient, aggressive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing low-cost creatures and spells that can target the opponent directly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and burn spells, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Fireblast to finish them off. The deck also includes cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize to help maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure. Ultimately, the strategy is to win the game as quickly as possible through a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature cards and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing low-cost creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Burning-Tree Emissary, combined with direct damage spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Impulse and Rally at the Hornburg provide additional card draw and potential for explosive turns. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through fast and relentless aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand while disrupting their spells with counterspells and removal. It uses faeries and ninjas as efficient creatures for card advantage and tempo advantage. There is also a focus on snow-covered lands for synergy with Skred. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage through cantrips and efficient threats, while maintaining control of the game through counterspells and removal spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts to take advantage of the Affinity mechanic, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing efficient creatures and artifact synergy, the deck aims to flood the board and outpace the opponent while also generating card advantage through spells and abilities. The inclusion of various artifact lands and support cards further enhances the deck's ability to consistently cast its spells and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Balustrade Spy and Generous Ent, then utilize Dread Return to bring back a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant for a game-ending combo. The deck also includes mana-ramp creatures like Elves of Deep Shadow and Overgrown Battlement to help cast larger creatures quickly. The deck focuses on synergy between creatures that generate mana and those that benefit from being in the graveyard, with the goal of overwhelming the opponent with strong creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly amass a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with low-cost artifacts and artifact creatures. By utilizing cards that synergize with artifacts, such as Galvanic Blast and Thoughtcast, the deck aims to maintain pressure and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Refurbished Familiar further supports this strategy by enabling card draw and removal. The deck also includes some disruption elements like Nihil Spellbomb and Hunter's Blowgun to control the opponent's options. Overall, the deck focuses on aggression and synergy to achieve victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a variety of artifact creatures and spells that benefit from having artifacts on the battlefield. By playing low-cost creatures and using cards that draw additional cards or deal direct damage, the deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression throughout the game. The mana base is primarily made up of artifact lands, which not only help cast spells but also synergize with cards that care about artifacts. The deck's strategy revolves around utilizing the affinity mechanic to power out threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Arbor Elf, Wild Growth and Utopia Sprawl, allowing you to cast big threats like Eldrazi Repurposer, Avenging Hunter and Annoyed Altisaur early on. Writhing Chrysalis and Malevolent Rumble serve as removal spells, while Boarding Party provides additional aggression. Mwonvuli Acid-Moss helps disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Thermokarst can remove problematic lands. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro Pauper deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arbor Elf, Wild Growth, and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful creatures and spells early in the game. Cards like Annoyed Altisaur and Avenging Hunter provide aggressive creatures to pressure opponents, while Mwonvuli Acid-Moss and Thermokarst disrupt their mana base. Malevolent Rumble and Writhing Chrysalis offer removal options, and Pulse of Murasa provides some recursion. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan while disrupting their resources.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to play high-power creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter. The deck also includes removal spells like Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble to clear the way for aggressive attacks. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana production and large, hard-hitting creatures, while maintaining board control with efficient removal spells.

The main idea of this deck is to use efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Seeker of the Way to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy with cards like Journey to Nowhere and Relic of Progenitus. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt to control the board and finish off the opponent. With a mix of artifact creatures, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan while also being able to adapt to different situations.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent by consistently playing low-cost creatures and controlling the board with counter spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Spellstutter Sprite, along with card draw spells like Of One Mind, the deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the board while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Snap also allows for additional card advantage and tempo plays. Overall, the deck focuses on being aggressive while maintaining control of the game.

The main idea of this Pauper Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of low-cost creatures and control spells. The deck focuses on using cheap creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Moon-Circuit Hacker to chip away at the opponent's life total, while utilizing cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell to disrupt their plans. With a mix of card draw spells and evasion abilities, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of pressure while keeping the opponent off balance with its disruptive elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures and control the board with counterspells and disruption spells. By using efficient card draw and manipulation, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent, capitalizing on early aggression to secure a win. With a strong emphasis on cheap spells and instant speed interaction, this mono-blue aggro deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and disrupt their game plan while steadily building towards victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. With a mix of low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining board presence. The inclusion of cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize provide card advantage and flexibility to adapt to different game situations. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure a balance between red and black spells, allowing for consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, supported by utility creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Outlaw Medic. It also includes evasion and pump spells like Greatsword of Tyr and Guardians' Pledge to push through damage. Prismatic Strands provides protection against removal spells, while Battle Screech generates additional tokens for added pressure. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of small creatures and combat tricks to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small creatures and pump them up with various combat tricks and anthems. The deck focuses on aggressive early game plays and maintaining a wide board presence to pressure the opponent. It also includes some card draw and protection spells to ensure the deck can keep up the pressure. With a mix of cheap creatures and powerful combat tricks, this deck aims to quickly build a threatening board state and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using low-cost, hexproof creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle to quickly attach powerful auras like Ethereal Armor and Ancestral Mask. By ramping up with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with massive creatures that are difficult to deal with due to hexproof. The inclusion of cards like Rancor and Armadillo Cloak provide additional power and lifelink to further solidify the aggressive strategy of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Balustrade Spy and Saruli Caretaker, then use Dread Return to reanimate powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant to overwhelm the opponent in a burst of damage. Utilizing ramp creatures like Quirion Ranger and Overgrown Battlement to accelerate the mana base, this deck aims to combo off through a combination of efficient creature generation, graveyard manipulation, and explosive plays to win the game in a swift and unexpected fashion.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Balustrade Spy and Generous Ent, then bring them back to the battlefield with Dread Return for a powerful combo finish. The deck also utilizes mana producers like Elves of Deep Shadow and Overgrown Battlement to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent. Masked Vandal and Faerie Macabre provide disruption against opposing strategies, while cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede help refill the hand and find key combo pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of card draw, counterspells, removal, and efficient creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells, while also filling up the graveyard with cards like Mental Note and Thought Scour, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Gurmag Angler. The goal is to outlast the opponent and control the game until the Dimir player can secure a victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using various gate cards to mana fix and stall the opponent. It also utilizes a strong draw engine with cards like Squadron Hawk and Brainstorm. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counter spells and removal and then close out the game with efficient creatures like Sacred Cat and Outlaw Medic. The deck aims to establish board control and limit the opponent's options while steadily chipping away at their life total.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a mixture of removal spells and creature threats, such as Crypt Rats and Avenging Hunter. The inclusion of cards like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas provides card advantage and resources for the player. The deck also features a recursion strategy with cards like Heritage Reclamation and Witch's Cottage. By combining these elements, the Golgari/Jund Garden deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a strong board presence while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on using a combination of sacrifice effects, card draw, and removal spells to control the board and slowly grind out advantages over the opponent. By utilizing Cauldron Familiar and Nutrient Block for recurring sacrifice triggers, along with cards like Pestilence and Eviscerator's Insight for removal, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also generating incremental advantage through cards like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. The Golgari / Jund color combination allows for a versatile range of options and flexibility in dealing with various threats.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to flood the board with small token creatures like Cloakwood Swarmkeeper and Nest Invader, while using cards like Many Partings and Writhing Chrysalis to generate even more tokens. Cards like Molten Gatekeeper and Eldrazi Repurposer provide additional aggressive threats, while spells like Malevolent Rumble and Glimpse the Impossible help deal damage directly to the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and finish them off with cards like Impact Tremors and Bequeathal.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl for ramp, the deck can quickly get ahead on mana and play powerful threats like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter. Writhing Chrysalis and Bannerhide Krushok provide additional value, while Malevolent Rumble and Ram Through help clear the way for your creatures to attack. With a focus on speed and aggression, this deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays to pressure the opponent early on. It includes mana ramp cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl to quickly cast powerful creatures like Avenging Hunter and Boarding Party. Writhing Chrysalis and Eldrazi Repurposer provide additional value by creating tokens or returning creatures from the graveyard. Malevolent Rumble and Horrific Assault offer removal options, while Pulse of Murasa helps to gain back life. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and efficient mana usage.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with low-cost creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with removal spells. The deck aims to generate card advantage through sacrificing artifacts and creatures, while also utilizing land destruction to slow down the opponent's mana development. By combining aggressive creatures, removal, and resource denial, this deck looks to control the game's pace and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of damage and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and creature removal to control the board while also generating value through cards like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and efficient removal spells like Cast Down. By utilizing sacrifice outlets like Krark-Clan Shaman and Fanatical Offering, the deck can generate additional value from sacrificing creatures, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile cards like Cleansing Wildfire and Nihil Spellbomb allows the deck to handle a variety of threats effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using efficient creatures and burn spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish off the opponent. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting and Highway Robbery help maintain card advantage and provide additional reach. The deck aims to close out the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence of aggressive creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker, while also utilizing burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to deal direct damage to the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and burn spells, finishing them off with powerful finishers like Fireblast. The deck also includes card draw and mana acceleration to maintain consistent pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures and spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, along with counterspells like Force Spike and Counterspell, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage consistently. The inclusion of card draw options like Ponder and Deep Analysis helps maintain card advantage, while Sleep of the Dead and Deem Inferior provide temporary control over the opponent's creatures. With a focus on speed and disruption, this aggro deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize.

The essence of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost, evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent while disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce. By filling the graveyard with cards like Mental Note and Thought Scour, the deck aims to reduce the cost of cards like Tolarian Terror and LÃ³rien Revealed, allowing them to be played earlier in the game. The inclusion of Sleep of the Dead provides a win condition by tapping down the opponent's creatures and clearing the way for an all-out attack.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tolarian Terror while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force Spike and Counterspell. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection spells like Thought Scour and Brainstorm to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. In addition, Sleep of the Dead and Deem Inferior provide ways to lock down the opponent's board, allowing the aggressive creatures to efficiently close out games. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure while maintaining control over the game.

The main concept of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to generate early aggression and consistent card advantage through the recursion of creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher. The deck uses artifacts and sacrifice effects to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of creature recursion, artifact synergy, and removal spells allows the deck to apply pressure while adapting to various matchups. The inclusion of a single Orzhov Basilica and Bojuka Bog provides additional utility and disruption options to outmaneuver opponents.

This aggressive Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a mix of low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly chip away at their life total. Using efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, along with additional reach from cards like Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss, the deck aims to maintain board control while also draining the opponent's life. The deck also includes card advantage and graveyard synergy through Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize to ensure a steady stream of threats and resources throughout the game.

The deck is focused on quickly bringing out low-cost creatures to deal damage to the opponent, while also using burn spells and discard effects to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Rakdos Carnarium and Bojuka Bog to provide additional utility and disruption against opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures with aggressive abilities and enhancing them with cheap combat tricks and burn spells to push through damage efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent early on, maintaining pressure with a mix of creature aggression and direct damage until victory is achieved. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive game plan, ensuring consistency in casting the necessary spells to close out the game swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By using cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary to play multiple creatures in a single turn, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of some equipment cards like Gingerbrute and Experimental Synthesizer adds a versatile element to the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and aggression to win games quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a tribal synergy of slivers, leveraging their abilities to buff each other and create a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Plated Sliver, Muscle Sliver, and Predatory Sliver work together to pump up the team and attack aggressively. Support cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede help to keep the slivers flowing onto the battlefield. The mana base is set up to provide the necessary colors for casting the various slivers and spells in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly through the use of walls and creatures that tap for mana, eventually setting up a combo where Freed from the Real can untap a creature repeatedly, generating infinite mana. This mana can then be used in conjunction with Valakut Invoker or Reaping the Graves to win the game. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and creature search spells to help assemble the combo pieces efficiently.

The main concept of this Weenie White Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, efficient creatures while boosting their strength with various creature enhancements and token generators. The deck also includes defensive options like Prismatic Strands and Mana Tithe to protect the board and maintain aggression. By quickly building a strong board presence and maintaining pressure on the opponent, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
